alert.note: Alert for Custer; Pueblo (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 28 at 5:08AM MDT until July 28 at 8:15AM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pueblo has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Eastern Custer County in southeastern Colorado... Southwestern Pueblo County in southeastern Colorado... * Until 815 AM MDT. * At 508 AM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Squirrel Creek and South Creek. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1.5 to 2 inches in 1 hour. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Beulah. This includes the following high risk locations... Beulah. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1.5-2 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
